message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Osteomalacia is a condition caused by vitamin D deficiency, which leads to bone weakness and pain. The next step to confirm suspicion would be to test for 25-hydroxyvitamin D, which is a marker for vitamin D levels in the body. Options B, C, and D are not typically used to diagnose vitamin D deficiency.
